column4: does anyone have a guide to make ubuntu spend less energy? i'm having too problems first my mmc0(card reader) is spending too much energy and the second is the comparison with Windows and Ubuntu in Windows its last 2hours, in Ubuntu 45 min
did you upgrade to the latest kernel? 3.0 seems to solve that problem for most people
well I suggest disabling compiz and using a lighter dm
personally I'm using xfce, its a balance beween being light and can be modified a LOT if you want
yes, apt-get install xfce4, logout and choose xfce from the dropdown menu
try that and see if your battery lasts longer(if that's what you mean by energy conservation)
witch packages should i get ? xfce4 and ?
that should install the minimal xfce, if you want goodies: http://goodies.xfce.org/
you're trying to make your battery last longer right?
ActionParsnip thanks i'll browse those goodies
do you have any idea how to resolve my MMC0 card?
